Description: Shoulder sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an amphora; pale slip; exterior, from top: traces of undetermined decoration; band with added red and white lines; black-figure frieze of sphinxes (one with face and forelegs missing, and face, chest and forelegs of second remaining) to left; splinter rosettes and dots as filling ornament; below, second band, then frieze with animal procession in silhouette style consisting of goat grazing to left (horn, shoulders and back remaining); short vertical bars, dot, and maeander cross as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For imagery parallels, see Oxford G119.29.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 36, pl. 22, no. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.010)
